dcterms:creator: M. Fomicheva
Shuo Sun
L. Yankovskaya
F. Blain
Francisco Guzmán
M. Fishel
Nikolaos Aletras
Vishrav Chaudhary
L. Specia
dcterms:description: The MLQE dataset is derived chiefly from Wikipedia articles and contains language pairs from high, medium, and low resource languages. Each pair has human labels for 7K train, 1K validation, and 1K test translation pairs.
dcterms:title: MLQE

dcterms:creator: Jörg Tiedemann
dcterms:description: The TATOEBA dataset contains translation pairs from various sources of more than 100 language pairs, focusing on realistic data sets for low resource and multilingual machine translation.
dcterms:title: TATOEBA

dcterms:creator: Pierre Zweigenbaum
Serge Sharoff
Reinhard Rapp
dcterms:description: The BUCC dataset is used for spotting parallel sentences in comparable corpora, focusing on extracting ground-truth parallel sentences injected into relevant Wikipedia articles.
dcterms:title: BUCC

dcterms:creator: Daniel Cer
Mona Diab
Eneko Agirre
Iñigo Lopez-Gazpio
Lucia Specia
dcterms:description: The STS-B dataset measures the degree of meaning similarity between sentences with a score ranging from 1-5, consisting of English sentence pairs extracted from various publicly available sources.
dcterms:title: STS-B

dcterms:creator: Adina Williams
Nikita Nangia
Samuel Bowman
dcterms:description: The MNLI dataset includes both written and spoken text from various sources, aiming to predict the label of entailment, neutral, or contradiction based on a premise and a hypothesis text.
dcterms:title: MNLI

dcterms:creator: Jörg Tiedemann
dcterms:description: The OPUS dataset provides parallel data, tools, and interfaces for various language pairs, facilitating multilingual processing and translation tasks.
dcterms:title: OPUS

dcterms:creator: Željko Agi´c
Ivan Vuli´c
dcterms:description: The JW dataset is a wide-coverage parallel corpus for low-resource languages, providing a substantial resource for training and evaluating translation models.
dcterms:title: JW
